text: Whats the benefit of this compared to the existing scripts and direct integration. Feel like this is just an extra step to go away from the prebuilt solution

<@U05CAJG8D98> I have multiple projects in a single repository, for small projects the direct GH integration is perfectly fine, that's what I was using too :smile: But with multiple folders it won't recognize the correct directory by default.

Also, as <@U05GWRCQ23B> pointed out, for bigger projects (we are launching a business with a service and a software side, multiple apps involved that all talk to HubSpot), you need to ensure that nothing gets uploaded to production unless 99.9% positive it won't break anything.

I've already had parts of a theme uploaded during development in the official HubSpot folder a few times in the past and it's not pretty, things break :grimacing:

<@U05GWRCQ23B> thanks for the rundown, really helps. I'm thinking of creating a separate staging folder for the theme and using HubSpot's content staging functionality, then only pushing to prod via actions. Don't think creating a staging project is worth it right now. Really helpful stuff, thanks!
